content:
Congratulations on taking the first step towards creating a YouTube channel and consistently posting on Instagram! That's a great start. Growing an audience and increasing engagement on YouTube requires time, effort, and a well-thought-out strategy. Here are some tips to help you get started:

**1. Define your niche:** While art, self-care, and personal growth are broad topics, consider niching down to a specific area, such as:
	* Art journaling for mental health
	* Mindfulness through art and meditation
	* Creative self-care routines for busy individuals
	* Personal growth through art therapy
This will help you attract a targeted audience and stand out from the crowd.

**2. Optimize your channel and videos:**
	* Choose a consistent and recognizable username, profile picture, and banner.
	* Write engaging, descriptive, and SEO-friendly titles, descriptions, and tags for your videos.
	* Use high-quality thumbnails that showcase the content of your video.

**3. Develop a content calendar:**
	* Plan and schedule content in advance to maintain consistency and reduce burnout.
	* Mix up the types of videos you create, such as tutorials, vlogs, Q&A sessions, and challenges.
	* Consider creating a series or playlist to keep viewers engaged.

**4. Engage with your audience:**
	* Respond to comments and questions in a timely manner.
	* Encourage viewers to subscribe, like, and comment on your videos.
	* Host live streams or Q&A sessions to interact with your audience in real-time.

**5. Collaborate with other creators:**
	* Reach out to fellow artists, self-care advocates, or personal growth enthusiasts for collaborations.
	* Participate in YouTube communities, Facebook groups, or online forums related to your niche.
	* Collaborations can help you tap into new audiences and build relationships.

**6. Promote your channel:**
	* Share your videos on social media platforms, including Instagram, Twitter, Facebook, and Pinterest.
	* Embed your videos on your website or blog, if you have one.
	* Share behind-the-scenes content or sneak peeks to generate interest.

**7. Analyze and adjust:**
	* Use YouTube Analytics to track your performance, engagement, and audience demographics.
	* Experiment with different content types, titles, and tags to see what resonates with your audience.
	* Adjust your strategy based on your analytics and audience feedback.

**8. Offer value and be authentic:**
	* Focus on providing high-quality, informative, and entertaining content.
	* Be genuine, relatable, and transparent in your videos.
	* Share your personal experiences and expertise to build trust and connection with your audience.

**9. Consistency is key:**
	* Regularly post videos to maintain audience engagement and attract new viewers.
	* Consider posting at the same time each week to establish a routine.

**10. Be patient and persistent:**
	* Growing a YouTube channel takes time, effort, and perseverance.
	* Don't get discouraged by slow growth or setbacks – keep creating and promoting your content.

As you've already established a consistent presence on Instagram, you can leverage that audience to promote your YouTube channel. Share your YouTube videos on Instagram, and encourage your followers to subscribe to your channel.

Remember, building a successful YouTube channel requires ongoing effort and optimization. Stay focused, adapt to changes, and continually improve your content and strategy to attract and engage your target audience. Good luck!
